content: All solvents and reagents for the syntheses were commercially available and used as received. The three compounds (MA-MOF, DMA-MOF, and GUA-MOF) were synthesized by mild solution methods. Taking MA-MOF as an example, it was prepared as follows: 25.8 mL of HCOOH (89%, 600 mmol) solution was added to the solution of CH3NH2·HCl (2.04 g, 30 mmol) in the component solvent of C2H5OH/dimethylformamide (200 mL, 1:1 ratio). After fully mixing, 100 mL of aqueous solution of Mg­(NO3)2·6H2O (7.69 g, 30 mmol) was added dropwise into the prepared solution. The solution was continuously stirred for about 2 h. The reaction vessel was tightly sealed by the plastic membrane and transferred to an oven. The resultant reaction was left at 60 °C for 2 weeks, and then colorless quadrate block crystals (0.5–2 mm in dimension) of X-ray quality were collected after washing with ethanol and drying in the air (approximate yield ∼ 55%). Single crystals of DMA-MOF (triangle prism) and GUA-MOF (octahedron spindle) were obtained by a method similar to that described for MA-MOF by replacing CH3NH2·HCl with (CH3)2NH·HCl and (NH2)2CNH·HCl, respectively (yield ∼ ca. 50 and 40%).
clean_text:
Experimental Section

Syntheses

All solvents and reagents for the syntheses were commercially available and used as received. The three compounds (MA-MOF, DMA-MOF, and GUA-MOF) were synthesized by mild solution methods. Taking MA-MOF as an example, it was prepared as follows: 25.8 mL of HCOOH (89%, 600 mmol) solution was added to the solution of CH3NH2⋅HCl (2.04 g, 30 mmol) in the component solvent of C2H5OH/dimethylformamide (200 mL, 1:1 ratio). After fully mixing, 100 mL of aqueous solution of Mg(NO3)2⋅6H2O (7.69 g, 30 mmol) was added dropwise into the prepared solution. The solution was continuously stirred for about 2 h. The reaction vessel was tightly sealed by the plastic membrane and transferred to an oven. The resultant reaction was left at 60 °C for 2 weeks, and then colorless quadrate block crystals (0.5-2 mm in dimension) of X-ray quality were collected after washing with ethanol and drying in the air (approximate yield ~ 55%). Single crystals of DMA-MOF (triangle prism) and GUA-MOF (octahedron spindle) were obtained by a method similar to that described for MA-MOF by replacing CH3NH2⋅HCl with (CH3)2NH⋅HCl and (NH2)2CNH⋅HCl, respectively (yield ~ ca. 50 and 40%).
